Package edu.ncsu.csc.CoffeeMaker.controllers

Class APIRecipeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.CoffeeMaker.controllers.APIController
      • edu.ncsu.csc.CoffeeMaker.controllers.APIRecipeController
  • @RestController
public class APIRecipeController
extends APIController
    This is the controller that holds the REST endpoints that handle CRUD operations for Recipes. Spring will automatically convert all of the ResponseEntity and List results to JSON
    Author:
    Kai Presler-Marshall, Michelle Lemons

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      APIRecipeController()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity createRecipe​(Recipe recipe)
      REST API method to provide POST access to the Recipe model.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteRecipe​(java.lang.String name)
      REST API method to allow deleting a Recipe from the CoffeeMaker's Inventory, by making a DELETE request to the API endpoint and indicating the recipe to delete (as a path variable)
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity editRecipe​(Recipe r)
      REST API method to provide PUT access to a specific recipe, as indicated by the path variable provided (the name of the recipe desired), with an updated price and list of ingredients
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getRecipe​(java.lang.String name)
      REST API method to provide GET access to a specific recipe, as indicated by the path variable provided (the name of the recipe desired)
      java.util.List<Recipe> getRecipes()
      REST API method to provide GET access to all recipes in the system

    • Method Detail

      • getRecipes

        @GetMapping("/api/v1//recipes")
public java.util.List<Recipe> getRecipes()
        REST API method to provide GET access to all recipes in the system
        Returns:
        JSON representation of all recipies

      • getRecipe

        @GetMapping("/api/v1//recipes/{name}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity getRecipe​(@PathVariable("name")
                                                         java.lang.String name)
        REST API method to provide GET access to a specific recipe, as indicated by the path variable provided (the name of the recipe desired)
        Parameters:
        name - recipe name
        Returns:
        response to the request

      • createRecipe

        @PostMapping("/api/v1//recipes")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity createRecipe​(@RequestBody
                                                            Recipe recipe)
        REST API method to provide POST access to the Recipe model. This is used to create a new Recipe by automatically converting the JSON RequestBody provided to a Recipe object. Invalid JSON will fail.
        Parameters:
        recipe - The valid Recipe to be saved.
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity indicating success if the Recipe could be saved to the inventory, or an error if it could not be

      • deleteRecipe

        @DeleteMapping("/api/v1//recipes/{name}")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteRecipe​(@PathVariable
                                                            java.lang.String name)
        REST API method to allow deleting a Recipe from the CoffeeMaker's Inventory, by making a DELETE request to the API endpoint and indicating the recipe to delete (as a path variable)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Recipe to delete
        Returns:
        Success if the recipe could be deleted; an error if the recipe does not exist

      • editRecipe

        @PutMapping("/api/v1//recipes")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity editRecipe​(@RequestBody
                                                          Recipe r)
        REST API method to provide PUT access to a specific recipe, as indicated by the path variable provided (the name of the recipe desired), with an updated price and list of ingredients
        Parameters:
        r - represents Recipe object with updated price and ingredients should have
        Returns:
        response to the request
